article:
'Status quo' is a Latin term meaning the current or existing state of
affairs. It is a commonly used form of the original Latin "statu quo"
â literally "the state in which". To maintain the status quo is to keep the
things the way they presently are. The related phrase [[status quo ante
(disambiguation)|status quo ante]], literally "the state in which before", means
"the state of affairs that existed previously". The opposite of
status quo is 'Anti-status quo' - literally "refusing to compromise with the
status quo." www.newspakistan.pk/2012/10/10/pti-clean-sweep-general-elections-
imran-khan/ This relatively new term was popularized by Pakistani
politician Imran Khan. http://thedefiance.co/the-last-hope-for-status-
quo/
